alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Wayne; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 9:23PM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Wayne, west central Knox, McCreary and northwestern Whitley Counties through 1015 PM EST... At 923 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Greenwood to near Sunnybrook. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Whitley City, Honeybee, Great Meadows Campsites, Marshes Siding, Slavens, Co-Operative, Kidds Crossing, Beulah Heights, Parmleysville and Mount Pisgah around 930 PM EST. Stearns, Blue Heron, Bark Camp and Youngs Creek around 940 PM EST. Other locations in the path of these storms include Deering, Pine Knot, Rye, Faber and Walden. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 19 and 25. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County near mile marker 22. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until midnight EST for south central Kentucky.
